result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.dispoDesc: this case dismissed and read-in with 14cf150

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kari Lynn Arthur

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Kari Lynn Arthur in court with attorney Michael Charles Hoffman.  John Martin Yackel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  forward bond to DOC  - this case dismissed and read-in with 14cf150
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Defendant Kari L Arthur in court with attorney Michael Charles Hoffman.  John Martin Yackel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  working on resolution - request short adjournment  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for February 6, 2015 at 01:00 pm.
Defendant Kari Lynn Arthur in court with attorney Michael Charles Hoffman.  John Martin Yackel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea/Sentencing scheduled for 1-16-15 @ 10:00 am.

Defendant Kari Lynn Arthur in court with attorney Michael Charles Hoffman.  Defendant Kari Lynn Arthur in custody.  John Martin Yackel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Scheduling conference scheduled for December 23, 2014 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Kari Lynn Arthur in court with attorney Michael Charles Hoffman.  John Martin Yackel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Acknowledges receipt of information. pleads NG  Scheduling conference scheduled for October 21, 2014 at 02:30 pm.

SPECIAL BOND Conditions with DAILY Testing
1. Defendant shall not consume any intoxicating beverages.
2. Defendant shall not enter the premises of any business that sells or serves alcoholic beverages by the drink.
EXCEPT that defendant may be on the premises of: 
for the purpose of employment, but only for the purpose of employment and only during his/her hours of employment.
3. Defendant shall be subject to DAILY TESTING if his/her blood, breath or urine, and shall report to the Sawyer County Human Services Department at 10610 Main Street, Hayward, WI (ph. 715-638-3317) within 48 hours upon release from custody (not counting weekends and holidays) to schedule an intake session with the Sawyer County Traffic Offender Program (STOP) and to establish the procedures for the daily testing. FAILURE TO REPORT TO STOP PROGRAM MAY RESULT IN THE ISSUANCE OF A WARRANT FOR THE DEFENDANT'S ARREST, MODIFICATION OF BAIL, POSSIBLE BAIL JUMPING CHARGES, AND/OR FORFEITURE OF BAIL.

Defendant Kari Lynn Arthur in court, in custody, with attorney Michael Charles Hoffman.  John Martin Yackel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Scheduling conference scheduled for September 5, 2014 at 09:15 am.

Defendant Kari Lynn Arthur in court, in custody, with attorney Michael Charles Hoffman.  John Yackel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant advised of rights/penalties, acknowledges receipt of complaint, waives reading of complaint.  DEF waives preliminary hearing.   State requests and court orders $1000 cash bond.  Court orders special conditions of DAILY testing on bond.  Arraignment scheduled for 9-05-14 @ 9:15 am.

SPECIAL BOND Conditions with DAILY Testing
1. Defendant shall not consume any intoxicating beverages.  Absolute Sobriety.
2. Defendant shall not enter the premises of any business that sells or serves alcoholic beverages by the drink.
3. Defendant shall be subject to DAILY TESTING if his/her blood, breath or urine, and shall report to the Sawyer County Human Services Department at 10610 Main Street, Hayward, WI (ph. 715-638-3317) within 48 hours upon release from custody (not counting weekends and holidays) to schedule an intake session with the Sawyer County Traffic Offender Program (STOP) and to establish the procedures for the daily testing. FAILURE TO REPORT TO STOP PROGRAM MAY RESULT IN THE ISSUANCE OF A WARRANT FOR THE DEFENDANT'S ARREST, MODIFICATION OF BAIL, POSSIBLE BAIL JUMPING CHARGES, AND/OR FORFEITURE OF BAIL.
Initial appearance on August 29, 2014 at 10:45 am.
